New Records: Georgia earned their first point at a major international tournament in Euro 2024.
Czech Republic attempted 12 shots in the first half, the most by any team since 1980.
Giorgi Mamardashvili made 8 saves by half-time, matching the highest by any goalkeeper at Euro 2024.
Patrik Schick became Czech Republic's top scorer at the European Championship with 6 goals.
Georges Mikautadze scored the latest first-half goal in European Championship history (48:20).
Georgia's 27 shots, 12 shots on target, and 3.1 xG were tournament highs.
Key Match Events: Georgia scored a late penalty in the first half to take a 1-0 lead.
Czech Republic equalized with Patrik Schick's goal, chesting the ball into an empty net.
Czech Republic attempted 46 crosses, the most by any side in a Euro 2024 match.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams knew a loss would risk elimination if Turkey vs Portugal ended in a draw.
Czech Republic aimed to capitalize on facing the lowest-ranked side in the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Czech Republic struggled without Patrik Schick after his injury.
Georgia's defensive resilience earned them a historic result despite facing tournament highs in shots and xG.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Georgia had nine yellow cards, the most in a Euro 2024 match since 2016.
Georgia's recent form showed three losses followed by nine draws and four wins.
Schick's injury dealt a blow to Czech Republic's attacking options.
Others: The match center provided detailed stats and analysis.
